alert.note: Alert for Lynn (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 03 at 12:59AM CDT until October 03 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Southwestern Lubbock County and western Lynn County. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1255 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated continuing light to moderate rain due to slow- moving thunderstorms. While the heaviest rain has ended, overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Up to 2.5 inches of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lubbock, Tahoka, Wolfforth, Slide, Woodrow, Reese Center, Wilson, Buffalo Springs, and New Home - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
